verses.roman:
tāsāṁ vāsāṁsy upādāya
nīpam āruhya satvaraḥ
hasadbhiḥ prahasan bālaiḥ
parihāsam uvāca ha

synonyms: tāsām—of those girls; vāsāṁsi—the garments; upādāya—taking; nīpam—a kadamba tree; āruhya—climbing; satvaraḥ—quickly; hasadbhiḥ—who were laughing; prahasan—Himself laughing loudly; bālaiḥ—with the boys; parihāsam—joking words; uvāca ha—He spoke.
translation: Taking the girls' garments, He quickly climbed to the top of a kadamba tree. Then, as He laughed loudly and His companions also laughed, He addressed the girls jokingly.
